Yes it's vista friendly.... as to how I know, it's becuase im running Vista 32-bit Basic. Im pretty sure in order to fix your issue you should download and install Microsoft XNA Framework 4.0 and/or Microsoft.NET Framework 4

@Happyworm
.... Well I could be a number of things.... but I'll go with some simple solutions.... 

1.) Right-Click the file and choose "extract to" and it will extract it into the same folder.

2.) If that didn't help Right-Click the rar file and at the bottom there will be a security tab that says "this file came from another computer and might be blocked to help protect this computer" and click unblock.

3.)If that didnt help try extracting it with 7zip..

4.) Final solution and your on your own (sorry) check if you have any malware on your computer as that might be an issue

My Terraria keeps crashing when I try to connect to a server. 
Am I making a mistake or something ?

Well, there seem's to be a bug which causes the game to crash whenever joining Multiplayer. Though there's not much you can do.... Of course I hear you can try to host your own server for you and a few friends, that might fix the issue....

 Oh and I did a bit of research and it appears that the crash mostly effects user's who have their Windows Display Language set on a Non-English language specifically French.
im having problems with running the .exe, its just chrases. i have windows 7 ultimate 32.bit Know any help?

@AtlasSys
As far as I know in order to fix the crash on start up you have to install Microsoft XNA Framework 4.0.

Legit release, virus is a false-positive, which IS due to the installer, game works fine.
I run with no anti-virus software other than Windows Security Essentials, and I have never had a virus from anything I've downloaded from TPB.
To fix crash issues, restart computer after downloading these, and it should work. Otherwise it is a hardware conflict, and is your problem.
